data.title: Family Birthday Dinner
data.text: Colas unique and changing chef inspired menu is awesome. Having to decide from daily specials is so hard. The waiters and waitresses present each special as though they create the menu with chef.

data.title: Nice for Business!
data.text: I was here with a group of about 15 business associates for cocktails and dinner. The staff was very attentive, solid appetizers, and the price fixe menu was excellent! I highly recommend their private room for a group of up to 25 or so.

data.title: Great evening with excellent service.
data.text: We had a table of 8.  The service was excellent and the restaurant has a very cool vibe to it.  The food lived up to the service and atmosphere.

data.title: Excellent Dinner with friends!!!
data.text: Walked in not knowing much about the place. Was there with friends that are locals. Very nice place!! Great bar area and service. Food was awesome!!! Braised beef on cheese grits!!! Very well done!! Highly recommend!!

data.title: No Wow Factor
data.text: The restaurant came highly recommended but failed to live up to the hype.  Reservation for my wife and I at 9 while visiting Columbia. From the time we entered to the time we left we never received a "welcoming" feeling. Arrived early and had drinks at the bar.  Hostess said she would let us know when our table was ready but she never came back and we actually had to wait several minutes after inquiring about our table.  When asking for a recommendation from the waitress she recited the menu back us. Appetizer was not good and wine list was okay. Entrees were good but the overall experience didn't present anything special to "want" to go back for.  Seemed to be too busy to provide good service.  Many seemed to be going through the motions.

data.title: Excellent dining choice in Columbia
data.text: Had a Friday dinner. We had reservations and were seated promptly. Food was excellent and innovative. Sauces were especially good. Wait staff was well informed, and with the exception of handling one large table which slowed service a bit the start but we simply took advantage with conversation. They noted the delay and comped the dessert.

data.title: Third visit, keeps getting better!
data.text:
It's definitely one of our Columbia favorites!
Oysters Rockefeller - OUTSTANDING!
Crispy fried flounder - GREAT!
The best grits we've ever had.
Very comprehensive wine list.
If you're in Downtown Columbia, give it a try.

data.title: Flounder dish "WOW"
data.text: The server was very pleasant and attentive. He suggested a few great choices for dinner and they all were perfect. I selected the Flounder and added brussel spout for a small up charge. The meal was just amazing! Looking forward to my next visit.

data.title: Beautiful space; delicious food choices!
data.text:
Loved the food...the spiced chicken was my choice and it was delicious.  My drink of choice was the raspberry lemonade:  smooth and so good.  Our entire group was pleased with each entrée, blackened chicken was a favorite as was the salmon, and with the drinks. We were celebrating two birthdays, and we enjoyed our meal and the restaurant so much; a truly beautiful space in the heart of historic Columbia.

Our group of 6 arrived at Cola's about 5 minutes before our reservation time.  Two other people were in line when we arrived, and the reservationist told us we would be seated at our reservation time. Fifteen minutes PAST our reservation time, we were finally seated, and the restaurant wasn't that crowded...empty tables in both sides.  Unless they were having a staff shortage, we weren't sure why we were told we would be seated on time, then ignored.  I am never bothered with having to wait, but on this occasion something just felt "off."   While the food and the space were wonderful, the staff seemed cold and aloof (or maybe they were just stressed?)  Our waitperson was very competent but made no effort at connecting with us beyond taking our order and delivering the food. She seemed annoyed when we asked her about certain food choices. We will go back in the future, and I hope to experience a more welcoming waitstaff.

data.title: Southern hospitality
data.text: First time to eat at Colas. Certainly won't be the last. Recommended by relatives. I would highly recommend. You won't go wrong. 5 of us ate there last Saturday evening. We did have reservations for 8:15. It's a very popular place. My husband and I both had the roasted beet salad and shrimp and grits. Wow! Perfect. We both had martinis and reordered. Yum. Mine dirty, his chocolate. One friend had the Pork Chop and Cola salad, another had the Trout and the 3rd had the mussels and beet salad. All loved their choices. The helpings are generous but not crazy. Our server was absolutely perfect as was our service. Everyone was cordial and very pleasant. As I said it was a busy Saturday evening. The weather was perfect and the place was packed. And everything went smoothly.

data.title: Pricey For What You Get
data.text: I've eaten here with the family a couple of times.  Last visit it was very loud and the food was average at best.  Seemed more like a after-hours bar than a nice restaurant.  I would not recommend for a family dinner with kids.  If you're a 20 something, and either have a good job or daddy's credit card, you'll love it!

data.title: Daughter's Treat
data.text: Visited our daughter in Columbia, where she treated us to dinner at Cola's. Space is awesome - attractive décor, big booths, beautiful bar.  Service was prompt, food was good.  We shared the toasted asparagus which were delicious.  The BBQ salmon was delicious, but too much spinach (the veggie it came with) for me.  Overall a very nice dinner.

data.title: Not bad
data.text: Food and atmosphere was nice. Loud professional environment as this seems to be a meet up after work. Food is as expected but a little overpriced.

data.title: Yummy
data.text: Fabulous dinner with granddaughter.  We shared a pear salad, an appetizer of delicious mussels, and a delightful dessert. As a main dish I had cracked and she had talapia. Both were perfect.

data.title: Excellent Food and Service in a Very Cool Building
data.text:
This restaurant never disappoints. Amazing cocktails, food, and service. Gilvert was our service, and he was extremely attentive.
Don't miss the cornmeal-dusted oysters, poached pear salad, and blackened redfish over corn cake. You will not be disappointed. This is definitely a place for foodies!

data.title: Excellent!
data.text: We had dinner at Cola's and everything was perfect.  The appetizers came out quickly and were delicious.  The entrees were incredible with a large selection to choose from.  I had the Basil Crusted Fish of the day and I would get it many times again. It was so flavorful with a huge serving of fresh veggies!  Make sure you get the Almond Basket for dessert!!!  The server was polite, knowledgeable and every on top of his work.  My glass of water was never empty.  The hosts were very nice and helpful too.  Everyone loved their meals and we will definitely be back!

data.title: Our Favorite Columbia Restaurant
data.text:
Have yet to have a bad meal here. We love this place, the decor, the service, the bar and the food.

From the pimento cheese to the salads, shrimp & grits, mac and cheese, Ford pork chops and the pan flash fried flounder is awesome.

Love this place

data.title: Noisy But Good
data.text: I had the pleasure of dining here for the first time on my birthday. Although the noise level in the Bar area was stentorian, the booth where we dined was isolated, quiet and pleasant. The food was surprising good and reminded me of Garibaldi's when it was at its peak. The server was attentive and very responsive. It was a delightful experience. The crusted trout was slightly overcooked.

data.title: Cola's
data.text: We had a large group that had dinner there and it was excellent. I had the scored whole flounder and it was wonderful. I definitely world recommend this restaurant to everyone.

data.title: Wonderful Dining Experience
data.text: Was able to get a table last minute during Parent's Weekend after speaking directly to Cola's although it was a 5:30 reservation.  The atmosphere was wonderful and food was amazing!  Our waitress, JoAnne, was delightful, very versed on all food items, and attentively efficient.  The snapper risotto special was delicious!  We each got a different salad and everyone raved over theirs!  I can't say enough good things about this restaurant.  Parking was a piece of cake with large lot right next door.  We will eat here again and again when in Columbia visiting our son.
